key_risks: High debt levels limiting financial flexibility
Intense competition from ride-sharing services and traditional rental companies
Regulatory and legal risks due to global operations
controversies: Multiple lawsuits and customer complaints over hidden fees and unclear pricing structures
$45 million settlement in a class-action lawsuit related to e-Toll fees
environmental_issues: Significant carbon emissions from traditional vehicle fleet
Scrutiny from environmental groups and potential non-compliance with tightening emissions regulations
social_issues: Customer trust erosion due to fee transparency issues
Accusations of 'bait-and-switch' tactics and 'drip pricing' by consumer advocacy groups
governance_issues: Execution and progress toward 2030 ESG targets under watch
Need for effective oversight by the ESG Steering Committee and Environmental Subcommittee

sources.title: Avis And Budget's Hidden Fees Exposed In New Lawsuit: The Dirty Secret ...
sources.snippet: Consumer group Travelers United has sued Avis Budget Group under the Washington, D.C. Consumer Protection Procedures Act for egregious junk fees charged on top of advertised rental car prices, characterizing the practice as "bait and switch" and "drip pricing." The lawsuit seeks both statutory and punitive damages.
